p:
The Altai Mountains, located in Central and East Asia, are showing evident impacts of the changing climate, including significant changes of ecological succession in the areas emerged from retreating glaciers
26– 28 . Although no relevant variations in the mean annual precipitation have been reported for the area
29 , the mean annual temperature in the Northern Altai Mountains has shown a significant increase of 1.3–1.7 °C in the last century
30 . This general trend was also confirmed by a comprehensive study that analyzed 50 years of temperature and precipitation variations in the whole mountain chain in both Russia and China
31 .
